description: Known as the 'Palace of Winds', this pink sandstone structure has 953 small windows and offers stunning views of the city.
A majestic hilltop fort showcasing Rajput architecture with a blend of Hindu and Mughal styles.
A royal residence complex that blends Mughal and Rajput architecture and houses a museum.
A UNESCO World Heritage site with architectural astronomical instruments built in the 18th century.
A beautiful palace in the middle of Man Sagar Lake, best viewed during sunrise or sunset.
The oldest museum in Rajasthan showcasing a wide range of artifacts and cultural exhibits.
Overlooking the city, this fort offers panoramic views and a glimpse into Jaipur’s royal past.
Home to the world’s largest cannon on wheels and a great place for exploring Rajasthan’s military history.
A modern white marble temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi, glowing beautifully at night.
An ethnic village resort offering Rajasthani food, folk dances, puppet shows, and camel rides.
